episode_title: 423-424 - The One With Ross’s Wedding Parts I and II

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey and Chandler are getting ready for the flight to London and Monica comes running in.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Guys, hurry up! The flight leaves in four hours! It could take time to get a taxi! There could be traffic! The plane could leave early! When we get to London, there could be a line at customs! Come on!! (She runs back to her apartment.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Six-hour trip to London. That’s a lot of Monica.
[Cut to the girls’ apartment, Monica is putting things into her purse as Phoebe and Rachel watch.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Passport, check! (As she puts away each item, she says check.) Camera, check! Traveller’s cheques, check!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Who are you saying “check” too?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Myself. Y’know for remembering to pack a thing. Yeah, you do a good thing, you get a check! (pause) My mom does it, I never realized it was weird.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, my mom used to put her head in the oven. Well, actually, she only did it the one time. But it was pretty weird.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! Are you ready yet?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yep! You got the tickets?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! Got ‘em right here, (Pats his coat pocket) check!
[Cut to the guys’ apartment.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s all London, baby! Here we go. (He takes a picture of a less than enthused Chandler and starts towards the girls’ apartment.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You got your passport?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, in my third drawer on my dresser. You don’t want to lose that.
(Chandler glares at him. At first Joey doesn’t know why, it takes him a little bit to figure it out.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh!! (Runs to his room.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There it is.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, continued from earlier, Monica is telling Phoebe where everything is.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, if you need the vacuum, it’s in my closet on the left-hand side. Ah, the garbage bags are next to the refrigerator…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, okay, but Rachel’s gonna be here too, can’t I just ask her this stuff?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, okay, give that a try!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right! Let’s do it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Woo-hoo!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, cheerie-o!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: London baby!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, ‘cause that’s not gonna get annoying.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: London baby!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, y’know what? I was wrong.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, we’re all here! I guess we should get going!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohhh, I wanna come over there and give you a hug and wish you luck on your wedding, but I don’t—can’t get up.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I’ll-I’ll come hug you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Great! Yeah, could you bring me the newspaper?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. (He does so and Phoebe hugs him.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, have a great wedding!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, hey, Chandler I wanna hug you too!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! (Trots over)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, and great! You might as well bring me my book, it’s on the counter in your apartment.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh. (Goes and gets Phoebe’s book as Rachel comes in from her room.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, we’re off.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Have fun!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks! (They hug.) Ugh, I can’t believe you’re not gonna be there!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So-so come! Why don’t you come?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: To London! Come to London. Please? It’ll mean so much to me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, well, I gotta work, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why-why can’t you take a couple of days off?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because, I can’t! Ross, I told you, no. I can’t.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is my wedding.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, y’know what? We really are late! Let’s go! Let’s go! Let’s go!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine. You’ll-you’ll watch it on video when we get back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here you go Phoebe! Here you go Phobo! Phewbedo! Phaybobo.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you.
(Chandler kneels down with his arms spread waiting for his hug.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you. (She pats him on his head.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, let’s go! Bye, Pheebs!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Bye, Pheebs!
(They all start out, Rachel gives each one a kiss, and says “bye.” In the hall, Joey says…)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: London baby!! (And Rachel slowly closes the door, sadly.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, do you need a hug? You don’t have to bring me anything!

(And with that, television history is made as, for the first time ever, an entire show moves it’s entire production to an entirely different country to make a single episode. We get shots of Buckingham Palace, London Bridge, Big Ben, and the London Marriott as Joey and Chandler exit.)

content.description: [Scene: Street in front of the London Marriott, Joey and Chandler exit. Joey is carrying a video camera and is shooting Chandler.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on! Do something!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am, I’m ignoring you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, here! (Gives him the camera.) I wanna be the on camera guy. All right, first stop, Westminster Abbey. (Joey folds out his “pop-up” map of London. All of the major landmarks pop-up like in a pop-up book.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, what the hell is that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s London, baby! All right, the hotel’s here. (Points to the map.) Wait. No, we wanna go… No. I know. (Sets the map down.) I’m gonna have to go into the map. (So Joey literally steps into the map.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, if you see a little version of me in there? Kill it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I got it! (Picks up the map and starts walking.) Here we go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. Listen-listen, we’re not gonna have to walk this way the entire time are we?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Shhh! (Pause) Man, you made me lose it! (He goes into the map again.)

content.description: Another street, somewhere along the River Themes, Ross, Emily, and Monica are walking to where they’re gonna get married. Emily is relating the troubles with the caterer.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: …and that was all before 10 o’clock. The caterer rang and said it was going to be Chicken Kiev instead of Chicken Tarragon. And then the florist phoned to say there aren’t any tulips. Oh, and the chilliest has carpel-tunel syndrome. We’re not gonna be…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa! Emily, (Gives her the time-out signal.) honey, okay?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Well, up yours too!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! No! No! That’s-that’s time-out!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sweetie, you gotta relax. Everything’s gonna be great, okay? Come on. Come on.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chicken Kiev?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Um-hmm! Doesn’t that sound delicious at the last minute?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, y’know, but something like salmon which would be so much more elegant than the chicken. And, you wouldn’t have to worry about the salmonella. (Ross pushes her.) So, I can’t wait to see this place you’re getting married!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. Yeah. Yes, this place is beautiful. Emily’s parents got married here.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I still can’t believe they’re tearing it down. It really is the most lovely building you’ll ever see. I mean it’s over… (She stops suddenly, when she sees that demolition has already started.) Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s nice.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh. Oh. (She starts running towards the building.)
[Cut to inside.]

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh. Oh my God. How can this be happening? What are we going to do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s all right! Everything’s gonna be all right.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: How’s it gonna be all right?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh, I see that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I talked to the guy with the shovel and I found out what happened.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They torn it down a few days early.

content.description: Westminster Abbey, Joey and Chandler have successfully navigated the streets of London and are approaching the Abbey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! Westminster Abbey! Hands down, best Abbey I’ve ever seen. Hey! (Pushes Chandler in front of the camera.) Okay. What do you think of the Abbey, Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think it’s great. It’s great. Y’know, they’re thinking of changing the name of this place.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really? To what?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: To Put the Camera Away!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man, you are Westminster Crabby. (He starts chasing Chandler towards the Abbey.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is trying to move off of the couch as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Oh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, honey! Don’t get up! What do you need?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, no. Oh, nothing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on! I am here to take care of you! What do you need? Anything.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I have a wedgie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, that is all you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So-so, what do you want for lunch?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I don’t know. I guess we have to eat.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I do. What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m just bummed about the way I left things with Ross. I shouldn’t have lied to him about having to work. He seemed so mad at me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Eh, don’t be so hard on yourself. If someone I was still in love with was getting married…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Still in love with?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not in love with Ross!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. No. No. Good! Yeah, me neither.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, I’m going to Ross’s wedding because he is my ex-boyfriend and that would be really uncomfortable. Not because, I’m still in love with him! I mean, hey, y’know, I like Ross as much as the next guy, y’know? Clearly I have feelings for him, but feelings don’t mean love! I mean, I still have loving feelings for Ross. Yeah! But, I have, I have continuing feelings of love, but that doesn’t mean that-that I’m still in love with him. Y’know? I-I have sexual feelings for him, but I do love him—Ohh! Oh my God! Oh my—why didn’t you tell me?!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We thought you knew!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, we all know! We talk about it all the time!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You all know? Does Ross know?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, Ross doesn’t know anything.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I can not believe you didn’t tell me!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, because we thought you knew!! It’s so obvious! God, that would be like telling Monica, “Hey, you like things clean.”

content.description: A park in London, Joey and Chandler walk up to a souvenir stand.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: The Vendor
content.text: So, what are you guys in the market for? We’ve got uh, scarves, tulip post cards…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Check this out? Huh? (Joey has this big tall hat with a British flag on the front of it.) Yeah. That’s the stuff. What do you think?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I don’t have to buy that, “I’m with stupid” T-shirt anymore.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I like it. Here you go. (He pays for the hat.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, look, you’re not really gonna buy that are you? Don’t you think you’ve embarrassed me enough for one day?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I embarrass you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How can I answer that when I’m pretending I don’t know you?

content.speaker: The Vendor
content.text: He’s just jealous. You’ll fit right in; all Londoners wear them!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh really? Then how come no one here is wearing them?

content.speaker: The Vendor
content.text: They’re all tourists.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, look, if you insist on wearing that, in public, y’know, you’re gonna spend the rest of the afternoon all by yourself.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah? (Puts the hat on.) If you’re gonna make me choose between you and the hat? I choose the hat.

content.speaker: The Vendor
content.text: Good choice.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, wait. All right, that’s it, okay, I’m out of here. I am not going to be embarrassed anymore! (He trips over a box, falls into a flower stand and walks away trying to be cool.)

content.description: The hotel, Ross’s room, Emily is entering.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! I just spoke to your dad, and you know what? He seems to think we’ll be able to find a new place for the wedding.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: We don’t have to.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa-whoa-what? You found a place?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: No. But, Monica and I were talking, and-and I was so upset about the hall being knocked down, and she suggested that we put the wedding off for a bit.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She said what?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: She said, “If I’m not gonna be happy getting married somewhere that we find in a day, well then we should just postpone it.”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Postpone it? Emily, do you think Monica realises how much our parents spent on this wedding? Do you my sister’s teeny-tiny little brain comprehends that people took time out of their lives to fly thousands of miles to be here, huh? (He puts his pants on backwards.) This isn’t right.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I realize that people are going to be disappointed. But, I’m sure they’ll come back when we can do it right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I can’t ask people to do that? Would you ask people to do that? (Holds out his pants)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Don’t you point your pants at me! (She throws them on the floor.) We have no choice! Anywhere that’s half-decent would’ve be booked months ago, Ross don’t you understand? This is our wedding I’m talking about.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The only thing I understand is; postponing it is not an option. This is when we’re getting married.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: So what are you saying? It’s now or never?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. I’m saying it’s now. (He starts putting on his pants, backwards again.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Or?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There’s no ‘or’ in mind. What is wrong with these pants?!!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: It’s not the pants. It’s you that is backwards. And if, and if you don’t understand how important this is to me, well then, perhaps we shouldn’t get married at all! (She storms out.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, wait! Emily! No, wait, stop! Emily, please—(He catches something important in the zipper and howls like a little boy and falls to the floor.)
content.parenthetical: chasing her, trying to zip up his pants. His got them on right now.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is on the couch as Rachel returns carrying a bunch of shopping bags.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, did shopping make you feel any better about Ross?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Manhattan does not have enough stores.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I think I can help you get over him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You can?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. I just need you to bring me some photos of Ross.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um-hmm.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And a small piece of chocolate.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And a glass of tepid water. (She gathers up all of these things.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, is this one of those things where you throw it in a bag with some graveyard dirt and hang it from a north-facing tree?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh, only if you have the hiccups too. Yeah, the pictures are for you, the water and the chocolate is for me. I just didn’t feel like getting up. Okay, I’m gonna show you a picture of Ross. Okay? And you’re going to remember all of the bad things about him. All right? Really focus on his flaws.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can do that. I certainly did it when we were going out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Umm, before we get started, I just wanna say for the record that I love Ross, I think he’s such a great guy. Here. (Hands her the picture, Rachel grabs it out of her hand.) Okay, now, close your eyes. And imagine that you’re with Ross okay and imagine that you’re kissing him. And you’re-you’re running your hands all over his body. And then you run your hands through his hair, but eew-oh gross it’s some kind of grease, it’s—uck! Hah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know, his uh, his hair never really bothered me that much, and y’know it was always more crunchy than it was greasy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, this is going to be harder than I thought. Umm, let’s try some uh, aversion therapy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So uh, now look at the picture…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, and umm… (She grabs the picture and smacks her in the head.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ow!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, how do you feel now?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I like you less!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s hotel room. Chandler is watching TV as Joey returns, still wearing his hat.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey. (He nods at the hat.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. (Takes off the hat.) Sorry!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no, y’know what? I really shouldn’t have said that you were embarrassing me, I mean that really wasn’t cool. And if it makes you feel any better, I’ve had a really lousy day.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Me too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Noo!! I’ve had the best day ever! Dude, check this out!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sh-shh-shh! (He motions for her to watch something he has taped.)
[Cut to the tape Joey made in front of some famous place in London with a rather famous English-type person.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, so say hi to my friend and tell him that you like the hat.

content.speaker: Fergie
content.text: Okay, so umm, what’s your friend’s name?
content.parenthetical: Yep, Sarah, the Duchess of York

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, Chandler.

content.speaker: Fergie
content.text: Hi Chandler! (Waves)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s… That’s was…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s Fergie baby!!

content.speaker: Fergie
content.text: Joey says you don’t really like his hat, but I think it’s kinda dashing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How did you? How? How?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I was trying to figure out how to get to Buckingham Palace, right? So, I’m in my map and-and…(Ross enters) Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi. I understand you had a little talk with Emily.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, I did! And you are welcome!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Am I?! And was it your idea to postpone the wedding?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m gonna go to the bathroom.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait up! (They both run to the bathroom.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey-hey, since you’re the ‘fix-it’ lady, here’s a pickle, what do you do when the bride says she doesn’t want to have the wedding at all?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She said that?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know, I told her it was stupid to put off the wedding just because the hall was gone and she liked flipped out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God. You’re even dumber than I am!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excuse me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, how long have you been planning this wedding?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know. A month?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Emily has probably been planning it since she was five! Ever since the first time she took a pillowcase and hung it off the back of her head. That’s what we did! We dreamed about the perfect wedding, and the perfect place, with the perfect four-tiered wedding cake (Starting to cry), with the little people on top. (Ross gets thrown a box of Kleenex from the bathroom and he gives her one.) Thanks. But the most important part is that we had the perfect guy who understood just how important all that other stuff was.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I had no idea. And that-that pillowcase thing, I thought you guys were just doing the flying nun.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sometimes we were.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on. You gotta help me figure out what to do. Okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on. (They leave and Chandler sticks his head out.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That was pretty intense huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. (Pause) Hey, I hope Ross didn’t think that we just went in there because we were uncomfortable being out here!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I hope he did!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the phone rings and Phoebe answers it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Pheebs! It’s Joey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, Joey! Hey! Ooh! Ooh! I just say someone on the—that looks just like you on the subway. And I was gonna go over and say ‘hi!’ but then I figured, he doesn’t care if he looks like you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That just cost me four bucks. But uh listen, I just called to see how the chick and the duck are doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, they’re having a great time with their Aunt Phoebe! Aunt Rachel hasn’t been helpful at all. So, do you miss me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Kinda, but I’ve just been having way too much fun.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So you’re not homesick yet?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, the seven of us miss you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who’s seven?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know, me, Rachel, the birds, the babies…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahh, the babies miss me?
(There is a knock on Rachel and Phoebe’s door.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, the pizza guy’s here!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? You ordered pizza without me?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. But y’know we were thinking about you, y’know we ordered the Joey Special.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Two pizzas?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yep! Okay, gotta go, talk to you later.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait, well, where did you get it from?!

(Phoebe has already hung up, leaving Joey in the dark. So Joey decides to watch some TV and turns on a rerun of Cheers, with the theme song playing. At first, he’s happy, but as the song progresses Joey gets depressed and homesick.)

content.description: Ross and Emily’s planned wedding place, Monica is dragging Emily in.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Monica, why have you brought me here of all places?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’ll see.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I tell you, this wedding is not going to happen.
(At that Ross plugs in some Christmas lights to light the place up.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay? But-but imagine a lot more lights, okay? And-and y’know fewer bricks, and-and-and flowers, and candles…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And the musicians, look, they can go over here (Points to a little alcove), okay? And the chairs can face this way (Points), and… (Points to Ross) You go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But-but, if you don’t love this, we’ll do it in any other place at any other time. Really, it’s fine, whatever you want.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: It’s perfect.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And, I don’t know, if it starts to rain…

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Well then we’ll get wet. (They kiss.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh. And I don’t even have a date.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is in her bedroom.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you remember where the duck food is?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, it’s in the guys’ apartment under the sink. Why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because I’m going to London.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?! What do you mean you’re going to London?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I have to tell Ross that I love him. Now honey, you take care, you don’t have those babies until I get back. (Kisses her stomach.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I—Rachel, you can’t go! Ross loves Emily!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I know, I know, I know he does. But I have to tell him how I feel! He deserves to have all the information and then he can make an informed decision.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s not why you’re going! You’re going because you hope he’s gonna say, “Yeah, I love you too, Rach. Forget that British chippy.”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh—Do you think he will?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! Because he’s in love with the British chippy! Look, Rachel, if you go, you’re just gonna mess with his head and ruin his wedding! Y’know, it’s too late! You missed you’re chance! I’m sorry, I know this must be really hard, it’s over.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know what? No. It’s not over until someone says, “I do.” (Exits)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I do! I do! I do! (Chases her into the hall, but Rachel doesn’t stop.) I do! (Gives up.) Ugh, like I can really chase you. I’m carrying a litter.

content.description: Moving Shot towards The Waltham House. A phone is ringing.

content.speaker: Housekeeper
content.text: The Waltham Residence.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh…yes..is this..umm..Emily’s Parents’ house.

content.speaker: Housekeeper
content.text: This is the housekeeper speaking. And by the way, young lady, that is not how one addresses oneself on the telephone. First one identifies oneself and then asks for the person with whom one wishes to speak.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is Phoebe Buffay. I was wondering, please, if-if it’s not too much trouble, please, umm, might I speak to Miss Emily Waltham, please?

content.speaker: Housekeeper
content.text: Miss Waltham, is at the rehearsal dinner and it’s not polite to make fun of people. Goodbye.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No no no, I’ll be nice, I swear!!! Could you just give me the number for where they are?

content.speaker: Housekeeper
content.text: I’m afraid, I’m not at liberty to divulge that information.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, somebody is on their way to ruin wedding okay. And I have to warn somebody, alright. So if you don’t give me that number then I’m going to come over there and kick your snooty ass all the way to New Glocken..shire.

content.speaker: Housekeeper
content.text: Hangs up.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hello, Hello. Ohh, OHH, she knew I could kick her ass.

content.description: Rehearsal dinner hall. Ross and Emily are standing in the reception area. Monica arrives with her parents.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi. Mom. Dad.
content.parenthetical: Ross hugs his mom and dad

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Sweetheart. Oh sorry were late, my fault, I insisted on riding the tube.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Judy, the kids..

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Jack, that’s what they call the subway.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Ohh, I thought that you…

content.speaker: Ross and Monica
content.text: Dad, dad. We got it!! We Got It!!!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ohh, here comes my dad and stepmum. Mister and Misses Geller, this is Steven and Andrea Waltham.

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: Hello. Hello. How do you do? How do you do? Very nice to meet you. (Looking over at his wife.) Darling it’s the Gellers. (She pays no attention she’s talking on a cellular phone.) (Louder) Darling, it’s the Gellers. (She’s still not responding.) She’s very self-absorbed, you know. I should never have married her.

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: Sorry, what?

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: It’s the Gellers!

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: Where?

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: Well there’s one (pointing towards Jack) and there’s another (pointing towards Judy).

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: Lovely to meet you.

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: Terribly nice of you to offer to pay for half the wedding. (He hand a multipage bill to Jack.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Ohh forget it. Too hell with tradition, we’re happy to do it.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: We know how expensive weddings can be, besides this may be the only wedding we get to throw (patting Monica on the shoulder.).

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ha ha, a joke that’s funny in all countries.
(Ross quickly directs the families to their tables.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey are standing by the kitchen entrance. A waiter comes out.

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: Sir? (Looking at Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s in it?

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: Goat cheese, water chestnuts, and panchetta. (Joey Looks down disgustingly at the food.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s not food…No, I don’t, no…(Taps Chandler on the shoulder.) Everything’s different here…I want to go home. I…I miss my family. I miss the coffee house. I can’t even remember what Phoebe looks like.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey, it’s been three days, okay.. Your just a little homesick, Okay. Would you just try to relax. Just, just try to enjoy yourself.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Your different here too. Your mean in England. (Chandler throws his hands up to his head in frustration. They walk away from each other.)
[Camera pans to the Geller family table. Ross, Rachel, Mr. and Mrs. Geller are there.]

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: What the hell!!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: what’s up, Dad?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: This bill for my half of the wedding. it’s insane.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: How could it be so much? The receptions at their house.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Flowers, liquor, recarpet first floor. New guest bath, landscaping. I’m paying to remodel this guys house. (Angrily gets up.) I’m going to give that son on a bitch, a piece of my mind.
content.parenthetical: Pointing items out on the bill.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dad, dad, please. Look I don’t want anything to upset Emily tonight. Alright, she’s had a hard enough couple of days as it is. (Picks up the bill.) Now here, here, let me go talk to him, okay?

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: And you tell him no one takes advantage of the Gellers.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Ooh, Jack…(He looks over to her) Sometimes I forget how powerful you can be. (They embrace and kiss passionately.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And I’m going to go get drunk. (Gets up to get a drink.)
content.parenthetical: Looking nauseous from her parents kissing.

content.description: An airport in New York.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, ooh, ooh,ooh,ooh. (Slightly out of breath) Hi.

content.speaker: Ticket Agent
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello. Umm, when is your next flight to London?

content.speaker: Ticket Agent
content.text: There’s one leaving in thirty minutes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, good.

content.speaker: Ticket Agent
content.text: And I do have one seat left.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, thank you, thank you, thank you.

content.speaker: Ticket Agent
content.text: The last minute fare on this ticket is twenty seven hundred dollars.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, I just don’t think I have enough left on my credit card.

content.speaker: Ticket Agent
content.text: Well you can split it with another credit card.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, okay, how about five. (She hands her all the credit cards.) Ohh, thank you.

content.speaker: Ticket Agent
content.text: I’m just going to need to see your passport.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, you know what? I don’t have it, but I can tell you exactly where it is on my night stand, and…okay. But you know what? I have my drivers license and I have a twenty. (She slides it across the counter.)

content.speaker: Ticket Agent
content.parenthetical: Slides the twenty back and tosses her credit card onto the counter.

content.description: The Rehearsal dinner hall. Ross is at the Walthams’ table discussing the bill.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, face it, my father is not going to pay for the build-in barbecue and believe me you can kiss you gazebo goodbye. Now I might be able to get you the new lawn.

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: Ahh, then you have to give us the lawn ornaments.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I go back there with lawn ornaments, he’s going to laugh in my face.

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: This is ridiculous. I mean we had an agreement. (Ross looks frustrated. She begins to scream at her husband.) Will you say something, Steven?! Please!!!

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: Don’t take that tone with me. (She looks evilly at him.) All-all right you can. (He looks over at Ross and Shrugs.)

content.description: The Girls apartment. Phoebe is dialing the phone and Rachel runs in the door.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, Pheebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh thank god. Oh, you changed your mind. Oh, look I know you probably want to be alone, and you don’t want to talk about it, that’s fine. I just want you to know, I think you are doing the right thing and…
content.parenthetical: Looking relieved. She puts down the phone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye, Pheebs.
content.parenthetical: Running back out the door with her passport.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait!! Where are you going?! What are you doing?! No!! Wait!! (Not able to get up.) God!! Why am I always pregnant when she does that?!

content.description: The Rehearsal Dinner Hall. Chandler, Joey, Ross, Emily, Monica, and all the bridal party are seated at the table. Chandler gets up to make a toast.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’d like to toast, Ross and Emily. Of course, my big toast will be tomorrow at the wedding, so this is kind of my little toast or Melba toast, if you will. (No one in the room laughs. He starts to get flustered.) Okay. I known Ross for a long time. In fact, I knew him when he was going out with his first girlfriend. (Ross looks embarrassed.) And I thought things were going to work out for him..Until the day he over inflated her. (He laughs. Jack looks at Judy and no one in the room laughs.) Ohh, Dear God.. (A cellular phone rings.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: Hello, Waltham Interiors.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, hi, Mrs. Waltham. I need to speak with ether one of the best men, or Ross’s sister Monica.

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: Who is this?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I’m Phoebe Buffay. I’m one of Ross’s best friends.

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: Well, if you’re on e of Ross’s best friends, why aren’t you here?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, um, I can’t fly. I’m having my brother’s babies.

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: Oh, am I on the radio?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No..umm, could I talk to one of them? It’s very very important.

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: No, I’m bored with you now. I’m going to cut you off. (She hangs up.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh! Okay, I’m going to have to kick her ass too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And I’m sure we’re all very excited that Ross and Emily are getting married at Montgomery Hall. I mean to think, my friend getting married in Monty Hall. (No reaction from the people.) Ohh, come on!! Monty Hall!! Lets make a Deal!! Come on, you people!! All right, forget it!! Congratulations, Ross and Emily. (He sits down.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, best man number two, Joey Tribbiani. Now I’m not good with the jokes like Chandler here. Boy…but ahh, I just want to say congratulation to the happy couple. I first met Ross in this coffee house back home…Home…New York City…Where everybody knows my name. Well anyway, I love you guys. (pointing at everyone.) But not as much as I love America. (Looking at Chandler.) Could we please..go home now?
(One of the bridesmaids, Felicity, puts her arm around Joey.)

content.speaker: Felicity
content.text: Are you going home? I was hoping to get to know you better.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m not going anywhere, sweetheart.

content.description: Later that evening at the rehearsal dinner. Chandler and Monica are sitting on a sofa. Chandler is covering his face in embarrassment because of the toast.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I was laughing. (Patting him on the knee.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Out loud?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well I didn’t want everyone to think I was stupid.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So how are you doing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My mother’s driving me crazy, but Ross is getting married. I’m happy. (A drunken man approaches.) I’m not going to let anything spoil that.

content.speaker: Drunk Man
content.text: I just want to say that Ross is a wonderful young man.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, thanks, we like him.

content.speaker: Drunk Man
content.text: My god!! You must have been a teenage when you had him. (Monica stares straight forward after the comment. Chandler tries to console her by patting her on the shoulder.)
(Ross and Emily’s parents are seated at a table. Ross is between them and they are discussing the wedding bill.)

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: There’s no way in hell, I’m paying for it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, were down to just one point. Could we please, maybe just settle it after the wedding.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: All-right fine, but I just want to say, I’m not paying for your wine cellar. You thieving, would be speaking German if it weren’t for us, cheap little man. (Emily’s stepmum looks shocked. Jack and Judy get up and leave.)
(Chandler’s trying to console Monica.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The guy was hammered, okay? There’s no way, you look like Ross’s mother.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Then why would he say it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because he’s crazy. Okay? He came up to me earlier and thanked me for my very moving performance in Titanic.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, my mother’s right. I’m never going to get married.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahh, you know what? That is…Who wouldn’t want you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, Please?! I’m a single mom, with a thirty year old son!!

content.description: The airport. Rachel runs up to the ticket counter.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, I’m back. Listen, I need to…

content.speaker: Ticket Agent
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello. I need to get on the 11 o’clock flight.

content.speaker: Ticket Agent
content.text: Oh I’m afraid that plane has already pulled away from the gate.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, you know what/ You’re going to have to call that plane and tell them to swing around and come and pick me up.

content.speaker: Ticket Agent
content.text: I can’t do that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sure, you know what? Come on, we’ll just tell them that there was like a problem with like the “engine”.

content.speaker: Ticket Agent
content.text: I’m afraid I’m going to have to ask you to step aside, Miss.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look, If I don’t get to London!! He is going to marry that other girl!!!

content.speaker: Ticket Agent
content.text: I can’t imagine why.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, you know what? I am not leaving here, until you call that plane back!! (She pounds her hand on the counter twice. The ticket agent counters by placing the closed sign on the counter and tapping it twice.)

content.description: Chandlers hotel room. Ross bursts into the room.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m getting married today!! Whoo-hoo!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Morning, Ross.
content.parenthetical: With the covers pulled up to his chin.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m getting married, to..day!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah you are!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ahh, whoo-hoo!!(He runs back out the door.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you think he knew I was here? (Chandler quickly looks at Monica not knowing what to say.)
content.parenthetical: Comes up for below the covers and looks concerned.

content.description: Chandlers hotel room. Chandler and Monica are lying in the bed together talking. There’s an awkward air between them. They are both clutching the covers in from of them.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well I’ve-I’ve never done that with you before.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nope. (She chuckles uneasily.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, ahh, how are ya? How ya…How ya… You okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yep, yep…You?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes…Yes..Uh-huh, You?(Looking over at her. She looks back.) We did you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well…I’d better get going.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yea yea, absolutely.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Could you not look?
content.parenthetical: Scoots towards the side of the bed.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t want to look.

content.description: The Virgin Atlantic flight to London that Rachel is on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhh.(she rhythmically taps her hands on the magazine on her lap.)

content.speaker: Passenger
content.text: Ahh, ahh, excuse me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Passenger
content.text: If you’re planning on doing that throughout the entire flight. Please tell me now. So that I could that a sedative…or perhaps slip you one.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. I’m sorry. I’m very sorry. Sorry. (She hums and sighs happily.) It’s just, I’m ahh, I’m kinda excited. I’m, ahh, going to London to ahh, tell this guy that I love him and… (He puts his headphones on to ignore her.)

content.description: Joey enters his hotel room. The phone is ringing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, were the hell have you been?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey. I spent the night out. I met this cute bridesmaid. She is so…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t want to hear about her!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahh Pheebs, you know you’re still my number one girl.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! No, we have an emergency. Okay? Rachel’s coming to London.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh great!!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No it’s not great. No, she’s coming to tell Ross that she loves him.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But, he loves Emily?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I KNOW THAT!!! You have to stop her!! She’s going to ruin the wedding!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, so, okay…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hold on. Hold on. (Picking up a note pad and writing and reading the message aloud.) Rachel coming. Do…Something.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, so I’m done my part, okay. It’s your responsibility now, okay. The burden is off me, right?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Right!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So tell me about this girl?
(The guys hotel room. Joey’s there. Chandler comes out of the bathroom in a robe.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Have you seen Monica?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not seeing Monica.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?
content.parenthetical: With a confused look on his face.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look we’ve got to find her. Phoebe just called!! Rachel’s coming to tell Ross she loves him!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my god!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know! That’s why we got to find Monica!! You know where she is?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No!! Okay!! What’s with the third degree?! Why don’t you just shine a light in my eyes?! (Joey looks totally confused.)

content.description: The plane. Rachel’s telling her story to the passenger on her left. The one on her left is still wearing his headphones.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …And so then I realized. All this stuff I had been doing. proposing to Joshua, lying to Ross about why I couldn’t come to the wedding. Was all just a way of…

content.speaker: Passenger
content.text: Oh, oh oh!! I’m sorry, can I interrupt? You know I just want to say..That you are a horrible, horrible person.
content.parenthetical: Frustrated he takes his headphones off.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ehh, pardon me?

content.speaker: Passenger
content.text: You say you love this man, yet you’re about to ruin the happiest day of his life. I’m afraid I have to agree with you friend Pheebs.. This is a..this is a…terrible, terrible plan.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But he has to know how I feel!

content.speaker: Passenger
content.text: But why? He loves this…this Emily person. No good can come of this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well I-I think your wrong.

content.speaker: Passenger
content.text: Oh-no.(He bites his fist at her.)And by the way, it seems to be perfectly clear that you were on a break. (Rachel gasps and doesn’t know what to say. He puts his headphones back on.)

content.description: The church where Ross and Emily are to be married. Judy, Andrea, and Monica enter together.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: Oh my God! It’s like a fairyland.

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: I know, it’s horrible isn’t it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I love it. I only hope my wedding looks this good.

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: I just hope…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You can let some of them go by!(Judy and Andrea go to the front of the chapel. Joey approaches Monica.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pisst, Monica. Alright, we really need to start looking out for Rachel. I’ll cover the front door. You watch that big hole at the back of the building and I got Chandler covering Ross.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why would I care where Chandler is? You know uhh…You know sometimes I don’t even like Chandler.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. (They both walk off to watch for Rachel.)
(Ross and chandler are standing next to the alter. Ross is practicing for the wedding.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I do. I do. I do.
content.parenthetical: Using a slightly different inflection for each.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yea, your right. It’s the second one.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?

content.description: Joey’s in the front entrance watching for Rachel. The bridesmaid he met at the rehearsal dinner come in.)

content.speaker: Felicity
content.text: Hello Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Felicity.

content.speaker: Felicity
content.text: Umm, I thought about you all day.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Felicity
content.text: Um-hum. Talk New York to me again.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fuggetaboutit. (She giggles.) How you doin?

content.speaker: Felicity
content.text: Mmm. (She pushes him up against the wall and they begin to kiss.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, yeah.
(Back in the chapel. The parents are still fighting over the bill. Ross is refereeing.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Geller
content.text: There’s nothing to discuss. We’re not paying for your wine cellar.

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: You-you have to meet me in the middle here.

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Hey, you keep pushing me on this, my foots going to meet the middle of your ass.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dad!! (Emily comes running in.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: What-what’s going on?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nothing, nothing. Everything’s under control.

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: You want a piece of me, sir? Is that what your saying? (Pointing at Jack and poking him) You want a piece of me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay! Okay! That’s it!! Parents!! Parents!! Back away!! All right, this is our wedding day! >From now on everyone gets along, and if I hear one more word. NO GRANDCHILDREN! (Pointing at his mother.) That’s right!!

content.speaker: Mr. Geller
content.text: Okay, okay.

content.speaker: Mr. Waltham
content.text: Sorry old boy, sorry. Sorry. Sorry. (Them all walk away. As he leaves he mutters to Jack.) I could kill you with my thumb, you know.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: What was all that about?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It was…This disagreement over…(She sighs. Ross notices her in her wedding dress.) My god. You…you look beautiful.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ohh…(She realizes that she’s in her gown.) Oh! You were not meant to see me before the wedding. It’s bad luck.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know what, I think we’ve had all the bad luck we’re going to have. (He hugs her.)

(The front entrance. Joey and the bridesmaid are up against the wall kissing. Rachel comes in the door and walks by Joey unnoticed. She walks into the chapel and sees Ross and Emily kissing. She looks as though she wants to cry. Emily walks away and Ross turns and sees Rachel standing there.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My God. Rachel! (He walks towards her, grasps her hands and kisses her on the cheek.) Your here. I can’t believe it. (She giggles.) What happen? Why are you here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well I just came…(She touches him near his heart. She’s almost in tears.) I just needed to tell you…(Looking into his eyes. She takes a deep breath.) Congratulations. (He hugs her. She can barely hold back the tears.)

content.description: Camera fades to one of the band members playing guitar at the wedding. The chapel is full of guest. A groomsmen escorts a bridesmaid down the isle. Joey is waiting with Mrs. Waltham to escort he down the isle. A cellular phone rings.

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: Hello, Waltham Interiors.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Mrs. Waltham. Hi. It’s Phoebe again.

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: Why?!
content.parenthetical: Throws her head back in disgust.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yea. Can I please, please, please talk to one of the best men? This is going to be the last time I promise.

content.speaker: Mrs. Waltham
content.text: Joey there’s a girl on the phone for you.
content.parenthetical: Slapping the phone into Joey’s chest.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh great!! (Putting the phone to his ear.) Hello. (He begins to escort her down the aisle.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Did you stop Rachel?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, but it’s okay. She just came in and gave him a hug, that it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So nothing got ruined?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh that’s so great! Ohh, so what’s going on now?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah, I’m-I’m walking down the aisle…Still walking. (Mrs. Waltham takes her place.) I’m about to pass the bridesmaid I hooked up with last night. (Looking at the bridesmaid.) Hey! (Talking to Phoebe.) I told her “Hey.” And now I’m at the front with Ross. It’s Phoebe. (He shows Ross the phone.) He looks pretty mad. Uh…I’d better go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No!! wait, wait, wait!! Oh please, hold it up so I can listen. (Joey looks at Ross and holds the phone above Ross’s shoulder.)
(Chandler escorts Monica down the aisle.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What we did last night was…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Stupid.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Totally crazy stupid. (He nods his head at the people seated.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What were we thinking?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m coming over tonight though, right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah. Definitely.

(They quickly take their places and Here Comes the Bride Begins to play. Everyone seated looks back. Emily is being escorted up the aisle by her father. She kisses him on the cheek and takes her place by Ross’s side.)

content.speaker: Minister
content.text: Friends. Family. We are gathered to celebrate here today the joyous union of Ross and Emily. May the happiness we share with them today be with them always. Now Emily, repeat after me. I, Emily…

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I, Emily…

content.speaker: Minster
content.text: Take thee Ross…

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Take thee Ross…

content.speaker: Minster
content.text: As my lawfully wedded husband, in sickness and in health, till death parts us.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: As my lawfully wedded husband, in sickness and in health, until death parts us.

content.speaker: Minster
content.text: Now Ross, repeat after me. I Ross…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I Ross…

content.speaker: Minister
content.text: Take thee, Emily…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Take thee, Rachel…(All his friends have looks of shock on their faces. He realizes what he said. Quickly he says.) Emily. (A slight chuckle.) Emily.

content.speaker: Minister
content.text: Uhh…Shall I go on?
content.parenthetical: Looking and feeling awkward. he looks towards Emily.

content.text: (Rachel looks all around as if all the eyes in the chapel were looking at her as the picture fades to black.)
